Advice to users on IT and IT Services problems. This may include how to repair damaged disks, solving software problems, or finding lost files etc....Password administration, issuing new network identities and passwords. Please note that there will be a charge for lost identities or passwords of £

Consumables sales, good quality floppy disks, and CD's are sold at very reasonable prices.Fault reporting service, to which all problems should be reported. These are recorded in a database and dealt with by the technicians.

IT Services guides are available to assist and familiarise you with a range of software.Prices of our consumables are available from the Help Desk counter.The Helpdesk provides students and staff with a single, helpful, first point of contact with the Computer Service.
Red telephones have been installed in most computer rooms to allow a user to contact the Helpdesk.Users whose problems cannot be dealt with directly by the Helpdesk will be referred to a technician.

There are six full-time members of staff who will be happy to assist you with computer faults. Students are expected to learn how to use the software provided from the guides mentioned above. We regret that technical staff will not have time to teach students how to use the software.
